website_summaries.verdict: A good quality wireless adapter for Windows computers, from a well-known brand.
pros: Provides speeds of up to 300Mbps even with its small size
Offers extended range with multiple antennas
cons: Some buyers note that the adapter can get fairly hot

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: I'll just throw it right out there. This sucker doesnt even get close to pushing advertised speeds. I get 3-4mpbs being 20ft from router. Complete trash. Dont waste your money on this. My laptop gets full 15mbps over its intel wireless card....yes I know my internet is slow. There was no other internet being used during test and I used several sites and compared to my laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Shata

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: My Internet driver/hardware on my Lenovo Ideapad 100 did not support 5G, and it's speed was measured at about 60Mbps on my cable provider. I bought this USB Internet adapter to access the faster speeds available on the 5G. My speed is now measured at 110Mbps. Though I expected something higher as advertised "Up to 430 Mbps speed on Wireless-AC 5 GHz band", doubling my old speed is acceptable, especially at this price. I am a little surprised at the chip itself, since the "LINKSYS" shinney logo was anything but shinney. It looked like it was left out in the rain.
customer_reviews.author: joeb

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy, doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: This did not work at all no matter what we tried and we tried everything. Bought this to hook up to my pc and connect to hotspot on phone. After trying all USB ports and starting and stopping and shutting down and restarting and literally everything else possible even restoring the whole computer the stupid flash drive not found and then when I clicked help it just tries to open the internet to help....um that's why we need this dumb thing you know to connect to the internet so obviously there is no internet connection to open the help screen. Returning no stars.
customer_reviews.author: Carloverrachael

customer_reviews.title: It works generally
customer_reviews.text: After installing the appropriate drivers for this device it's odd that it randomly drops the connection. Unplug it and plug it back in again it works. We use it on a desktop that I didn't want to run a wire to so it's stationary. It is one floor up from the router and the router is in the room directly below the desktop. All other wireless devices do not have the dropping off the network issue that this dongle has. All it has to do is not drop the connection so frequently that I notice it.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Don't be tempted by the "name brand" this thing is a complete piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: So you go on amazon, you see a whole bunch of wifi adaptors from Chinese companies you never heard of. How can you trust them? You can't really, so you go and buy a name brand you recognize Linksys! Well if you do that, don't buy this absolute piece of garbage. It's one of the worst wifi adaptors I've ever had. I am quite literally 20 feet away from my wifi router and have a constant low signal that throttles my internet speed to less than a quarter of what I get when I run a cat-5 cable. The linksys support is terrible, deceiving, and outdated. Under no circumstances should you buy this garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good reception and speed without signal loss
customer_reviews.text: Well, Linksys makes great networking equipments. Few things I like about this wireless WIFI adapter: - NO signal loss so far. - Good build quality - great price I used to have intermittent signal loss in some of the other brand that I bought before, but I have been using Linksys WIFI adapter for few months now and hardly have signal loss. It works great. The build quality is great and the price is right as well.
customer_reviews.author: Devon Stha

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: Awful product they are still sending out with a CD! WHO uses CD's in their computers to download today? They had no online download and customer service was a joke. Just tried to upsell me and recharge me. Didnt stand behind their product Spent more than an hour trying to get problem fixed. In the end just returned it. Wont be buying ANYTHING linksys again, ever.
customer_reviews.author: Sonya Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Required internet to install drivers? Works great otherwise!
customer_reviews.text: I've definitely used many USB wifi adapters that worked with Windows's native drivers, however this one did not. Since the computer didn't have a disc drive to use the included disc, I had to use a laptop with an ethernet port to share my connection so that the computer this was connected could get internet and install its drivers required to function. After that it worked flawlessly and signal was very good despite being in one of the furthest spots in the house from the router.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Easy to get going
customer_reviews.text: Setup was easy. Keep in mind if your laptop does not have a CD drive, you will need to get the setup files onto a thumb drive and copy them over to your laptop or run the install from the thumb drive. After copying the files, I was going in less than a minute or so. Make sure you have your WIFI password handy and turn of MAC filtering on your router if you have it enabled. This device doubled my laptop speed. I attribute that to the fact that my inexpensive laptop probably supported only 2.4 GHZ so running now at 5GHZ made the difference. Definitely work the money.
customer_reviews.author: Exchange Admin

customer_reviews.title: Linksys Wireless Mini USB Adapger AC 580
customer_reviews.text: When I used the Wi-Fi adapter built into my laptop, I only got half the speed I could get when wired, so I have had wires running everywhere to use my laptop at it's full potential. I bought this on a whim and I'm glad I did. I get the same internet speed running wireless with the Linksys adapter as I do running my Cat5 cable. It's hard to believe something this small can work so well. I highly recommend it. Just remember to go into your "power" properties and unclick the ability of your laptop to turn the item off to save power so you don't randomly lose your internet connection.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur W Russell

customer_reviews.title: AVOID THIS PRODUCT!!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for a couple of months, then stopped working. Contacted Linksys about the problem, got a replacement, and that doesn't work, either! Currently trying to get a refund from Linksys, but I am currently getting the runaround. They offer just a "replacement policy" with the identical unit and software! What's the definition of "insanity"?
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last very long, but worked when it worked.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a month or so ago, now when I plug it into ANY USB port it doesn't even turn on (blue light), no detection basically going in the garbage now. Had to plug in tp-link usb adapter that's been laying around for years. Sadly I bought this because of the brand name.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony T

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Works on a home built PC with WIN 10 and a Linksys EA6350 wireless outer. No problems as yet. Edit 12/4/2017 I often have to plug it back in to get it recognized and functional at startups. But now my download speeds have been effected and I'm using the wired Ethernet again. I'm under the suspicion some of this may be to new updates on Windows and Firefox that I've been having other issues with. Idk if there's any useful updates for this either. Not sure if I should upgrade this hub to the next model along with the modem and router. Xfinity won't support my own modem now for resets.
customer_reviews.author: C. Mayer

customer_reviews.title: Who Needs Antennas?
customer_reviews.text: Wasn’t sure about a WiFi dongle without an antenna. Something about having to screw in an antenna just makes you think it will work better. But after buying numerous cheap USB WiFi dongles (with antennas of course) that didn’t work, I went for something affordable from Linksys. It works like a charm. Very happy. And not having antennas saves a lot of space :)
customer_reviews.author: Gabi

customer_reviews.title: Lightyears ahead of my old Adapter
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a $50 Edimax 3T3R for the last 2 years or so with terrible performance that I had thought was just my house wifi. Bought this new adapter for a new PC I'm building and holy crap. My Edimax is terrible. 20mbps compared to the 0.5-1mbps I had on the Edimax. Just bought a second one. The only reason I'm giving this 4 stars instead of five is that it just delivered today and it doesn't feel as tank-ish as the Edimax did and I don't know how it'll be long term. So far extremely impressed though
customer_reviews.author: Robert III

customer_reviews.title: I bought this WiFi stick to connect to my already ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this WiFi stick to connect to my already set up WiFi in my house. It had to be installed by a disk and then asked me to update my windows software or else it couldn't install. I cant get on the internet because my WiFi stick wont connect to the internet for me to update anything! If you don't have a cable to directly plug into your modem then you're screwed. I'm lucky my father in law is an IT guy and was able to come over and download a few drivers for me to install this stick. It was a hassle. You cant just plug it in and it picks up your already existing WiFi.
customer_reviews.author: brandie cusack

customer_reviews.title: Died after two days
customer_reviews.text: Well, this turned out to be a total waste of money. I have another Linksys USB wifi adaptor that works great. I couldn't tell if this was the same one, but it looked similar so I got it. It's not the same one. It didn't work anywhere near as well - the signal was much weaker, though it did work... for less than two days. Now the light won't even come on. Complete junk.
customer_reviews.author: Farrar M. Williams

customer_reviews.title: easy to install, but has serious problem with overheating and ceasing function
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this after the wireless internet connection on my HP computer ceased to function. Easy to set up. Initially this worked well, and I liked it very much. However it routinely overheats, which first appears as slowing of internet connection (touch the adapter and it is warm), and sometimes will completely stop. If you remove adapter and let it cool for 10 or 15 minutes it works again. However, it only takes about 15 to 20 min of internet time to overheat. Not worth buying when there are so many other choices which do not appear to have this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not made for use in United States
customer_reviews.text: This item Linksys AE1200 Wireless-N Adapter is clearly marked NOT FOR SALE OR USE IN THE UNITED STATES All this time I thought I was not experienced enough to use this adapter. Since I have had it for several months, I cannot return the item. The vendor should not sell items not meant to be used in this country. Meredith Maryland, USA
customer_reviews.author: stonewood

customer_reviews.title: Needs a dvd or alternative connection to wifi to setup
customer_reviews.text: You need a cd/DVD drive to install this. Windows does not have a driver built in, so you need a driver or another way to connect to the internet Works good but my machine doesn't have a DVD drive and I dont have a wire at home. Thankfully I found an external drive
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy if you have win 8 or higher operation system
customer_reviews.text: I would say do not purchase this adepter if you are using Windows 8 or 10 This adapter only Support Win Xp,Vista & 7. All those previous Windows softwares are outdated . I have Win10 and adepter failed to install on two different PCs..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Buyer

customer_reviews.title: If you need computer type equipment, shop Amazon merchants first.  I have found everything I need here.
customer_reviews.text: Finally, my tablet works! I tried connecting my tablet with all kinds of adapters I had and using all methods recommended by the instructions that came with it, but nothing was working. I needed a brand new adapter and that was all there was to it. So, I came to Amazon and got my Linksys AE1200 Wireless-n USB Adapter. Way less inexpensive than getting it from Linksys. Instantly, I was connected and have been ever since.
customer_reviews.author: funnierthanme

customer_reviews.title: The product is useless. I ordered a Netgear AC1200 adapter
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly, this adapter (driver) is not compatible with Windows 10. It is also USB 2.0 I called Tech support at Linksys and they told me there is no updated Windows 10 compatible driver and no date could be given regarding release of a compatible driver. I couldn't get it to work. The product is useless. I ordered a Netgear AC1200 adapter .. the reviews of that were great and it is USB 3.
customer_reviews.author: D Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Ok. The house is probably part of the problem
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work well, but we live in a mid century house with concrete block construction and likely at least a layer of two of lead based paint probably somewhere among the layers, which according to my internet providers is close to impossible. We have a secondary router sending the signal down the hall, so probably the best we can do. However the old Linksys adapter seemed to do a better job until it died.
customer_reviews.author: Glorianna

customer_reviews.title: Magnificent Adapter
customer_reviews.text: I do not have much to say except , Linksys Wireless Mini USB Adapter AC 580 Dual Band (AE6000) . Is the best WiFi adapter i have ever owned & actually seen the speeds i should be getting unlike them crap WiFi adapters built in laptops & other devices . I have a Linksys WRT AC 1900 + this mini USB Linksys adapter & my Speeds are insane through 5GHz band WiFi & always excellent signal strength. Photo of speedtest using this adapter + router WRT AC 1900. :) I went from 20mbps to 101mbps+ !
customer_reviews.author: mark b

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: the linksys website doesnt show windows 10 support for the adapter, but it works fine. you'll need a current working internet connection, then you simply plug in the linksys AE1200, then with you old connection & the new Linksys adapter installed, you manually search for new updates with windows 10 update. it will see the new adapter & download the driver needed. then you can remove you old adapter or internet connection & youre all set.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

customer_reviews.title: ) Very pleased!!
customer_reviews.text: I don't even have to turn the wifi on,,,on my laptop. This linksys handles it all and fast. Now I can connect and check my email when I am camping. Update unplugged the linksys today and it fell apart. Obviously its very cheaply made. I tried to snap it back together ...because all it is...is a casing on one side...one on the other side and the USB stick in the middle. It wont even snap back together. Had to tape it. Linksys needs to work on keeping this versatile unit in tact. The casing should meet the performance half way.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonymous

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you have a CD rom drive
customer_reviews.text: It works, but I had to work to hard to get it to install. I have two small form factor PCs that I needed to access wirelessly until I could run the Cat 6 cable to the basement. Neither of my PCs has a CD rom, which is necessary for the install. It shouldn't be that hard to at least get a bare-bones minimum driver installed to allow it to connect to the wireless access point. Ultimately I had to purchase a small USB CD rom driver to install these. Not happy about that. Once installed, it does work well connecting to my Cisco SMB router, although the speed rarely connects at anything above 150mps.
customer_reviews.author: fuel98rider

customer_reviews.title: Works great for low price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought because my more expensive Asus couldn't connect to anything. This one connected within seconds and has worked perfectly ever since. Edit: Later found the issue was actually with Windows and not the Asus. This one has continued to work fine though.
customer_reviews.author: Kitt

customer_reviews.title: Great Adapter
customer_reviews.text: I bought a $500 computer and, although I knew it wouldn't be a stellar computer, I was shocked to discover that I couldn't even access my WiFi (which is placed in my den) from my kitchen table! This little adapter changed all of that - I can now easily surf the web anywhere in my house. I also bought a new router, and, together, I can access the internet from my porch and either yard. I recommend this adapter to anyone who wants more range or speed in their WiFi connection.
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This adapter is great. I bought it for my new desktop which was lan line only. I followed the simple instructions for installation and it has worked perfectly ever since. I was on the fence about this product since others have said they had problems with losing connection, buy I haven't had any connectivity issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Faba

customer_reviews.title: Works well but slower than advertised
customer_reviews.text: My older laptop wi-fi adapter only pulls in a signal at 72 mbps and only operates on the 2.4GHz band. This was too slow for my needs. I thought I would go with a USB adapter as I can plug it into my USB extension port when at home. I loaded the software that came on the CD and plugged in this adapter and it found the network right away. I configured it to run on the 5GHz band and am now running at around 150 mbps. It is better than what I had, but I was hoping to get around 300 mbps. I am only 25 feet away from the router.
customer_reviews.author: BobPT

customer_reviews.title: Works really well!
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my old Windows XP computer that I am currently refurbishing. It works really well, and the signal strength is like i'm right next to the router, despite being across the house. The CD is stylish, the driver installation is quick and easy, and it works without a problem. The only problem I've encountered, is after installing the drivers, the computer shut down with a "critical error" which happens quite often. The box is small and simple, it's also stylish. I also like the actual design of the adapter itself.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Hill

customer_reviews.title: easy installation and connect
customer_reviews.text: I didnt need anything fancy so I go for this , and installation so easy, just pop in the CD disk and install it and work immediately and I am on 2nd floor the modem is on the first , very good connection so far and play CS on it with no problem
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Cheap fix for WiFi
customer_reviews.text: My laptop is a great computer except for the crappy wireless card. If I was within 5 feet or so from the router it did okay. If I'm further away it's been hit or miss. I just got this adapter today, ran the setup with the cd and plugged it in. Now my wireless connection is great and my laptop is running as it should. I'll update this review if anything changes, but right now I'm glad that $20 fixed my problem so easy.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart K. Lankford

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for a couple of weeks...
customer_reviews.text: This worked well for a couple of weeks. After that it started dropping from the network very quickly, and wouldn't stay connected. If there was a way to keep it from overheating, it would work wonderfully. Unfortunately, it starts heating up as soon I plug it in and, after about 30 minutes it won't stay connected.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... Netgear wireless adapter and at first it worked just fine. However
customer_reviews.text: We first purchased the Netgear wireless adapter and at first it worked just fine. However, after about 6 months it would not recognize the computer and we would always get a error message on our screen. So we purchased the Linksys, (which everything else in our home is) and the startup is a breeze. It is 3 on screen steps. We LOVE this! I can't figure out why we ever picked the netgear product.
customer_reviews.author: Kerri B Herman

customer_reviews.title: Easy Installation
customer_reviews.text: This simple device has solved my wifi issues. I have a built in wifi card in my computer but it must be going out. This device allows me to always have internet connection. So now I don't have to replace my computer. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Schreck

customer_reviews.title: Did the Trick!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to compensate for the almost constant interference with the wifi around my house. Just "plug 'n play" and I am not bothered by losing my Internet connection any longer. This sticks out an inch or two from my laptop, so I made sure to allow for that by placing the laptop on a wider surface to keep myself from knocking or bending it. Great, prompt delivery and packaging as well.
customer_reviews.author: bonita herren montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Great adapter for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great adapter for the price. The network card in my work laptop went out and I ordered this to use while I wait for a replacement. It seems to have good range and a strong connection, so glad I got this as opposed to more expensive versions I saw when I checked at Staples before ordering here.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Started having issues about 3 weeks into use.
customer_reviews.text: Started out nice. Worked well. Started dropping my connection earlier this week. Light went out today. Unplugged and plugged it back in again. Worked for about 5 minutes. It's old tech. what do you expect.
customer_reviews.author: csm

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I have a dedicated laptop out in my garage mostly for iTunes. The wifi receiver on it broke so I bought and plugged this in. It works great. My laptop's cd player is broken so the enclosed cd with drivers was useless. I had to go to the Linksys website and download the driver. No big deal but they could have included the URL in the setup disk installation guide.
customer_reviews.author: jackoc7

customer_reviews.title: easy to install (literally plugged it in and it was ...
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, easy to install (literally plugged it in and it was ready to go, didn't have to install anything or use the included CD or anything), and gives me super speedy 5 GHz wifi on my desktop that didn't come with built in wireless.
customer_reviews.author: Link Burchett

customer_reviews.title: Does not do what I expected
customer_reviews.text: After I installed it, it says it is connected to the internet, however it does not show up on MYPC as something I can connect to through my laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Mc

customer_reviews.title: When it works, it works well, but....
customer_reviews.text: I experienced problems with this device on a Windows 7 - 64bit platform. I admit, my computer is a little old, but I kept getting dropped from the network. I tried reloading drivers, updating firm ware, etc. etc. I am connecting to a Linksys AE6400 802.11ac router, so I would hope they are compatible, but still no luck resolving my issues. Additionally, I don't see a marked difference in throughput. I was replacing a 802.11n adapter, but since that adapter still works and does not drop me several times a day, I went back to it. I am going to buy a newer computer later this year, maybe I'll try again.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian E

customer_reviews.title: Speed increase quit working after 3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Definitely increased my speed to my router. Does get warm. I just put a cheap fan on it and it behaves nicely. Worked for 3 weeks then crapped out. I would not recommend buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it already!!
customer_reviews.text: Instead of running wires for internet, we did this! Works amazing! Speed is only minorly affected. Husband can still do his gaming of world of warcraft and league of legends! Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work consistently
customer_reviews.text: Constantly disconnects. I have to unplug it from the PC and plug it back in to get it to work. I probably won't buy Linksys again after this one.
customer_reviews.author: Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Soooo easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Installation couldn't be simpler. It comes with a disk which you run before plugging in the adapter. I installed on an old Dell PC running Windows 7. After grinding away for quite a while, I was instructed to plug it in. Shortly thereafter, installation was complete and ever since, it has performed flawlessly. Couldn't be more satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: firstdube

customer_reviews.title: CD IS USELESS, download the set-up installation from web-site only!
customer_reviews.text: I liked how easy it was to install from the web-site, the, CD was a joke! Don't even need it, it was useless...good delivery...& product once installed...
customer_reviews.author: Jazmine Rose Joplin

customer_reviews.title: Can I get my $ back from Cisco?
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these, one for me, and another for my wife in a nursing home. The one on my computer works well, it is next to the router. the other I attempted to install in my wife's nursing home room. It failed to pick up anything. Instead, I bought a $21.99 adapter TP-LINK TL-WDN3200 N600 Dual Band Wireless USB Adapter, and it works like a charm, and my76 wife is about 200 feet from the end point.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Has worked well so far
customer_reviews.text: After moving to a new house I ended up with my desktop computer in a different room from where the modem and router were located. Since there was no wireless built in I bought this USB adapter instead of trying to run a cable between rooms. It installed easily and has work without a single problem for the 2 months I’ve had it. I don't stream movies or TV so cannot talk about that type of performance but it has worked fine when viewing videos on YouTube and other websites.
customer_reviews.author: John Harris

customer_reviews.title: Overheats and fails to work
customer_reviews.text: This device has a well documented and known issue which causes it to overheat and disconnect on some computers. Linksys do not offer support or updates for this adapter anymore, which means that it will likely never be fixed in a future driver or firmware update. Best to avoid this particular model and go with another, more recently-developed one instead like the Linksys AC1200.
customer_reviews.author: Seabassil

customer_reviews.title: Total piece of junk, waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Never gets more than 1 bar. It works only if it is sitting right next to the router. Otherwise, it takes forever to load a page. WiFi for other devices work beautifully at the same location where this does not work. So the problem is not in the router. The contact of the adapter feels loose.
customer_reviews.author: Busy Mom Lee

customer_reviews.title: Small and compact!
customer_reviews.text: Small and compact! Very easy to install. The unit arrived well packaged and had a driver disk for the install inside the box. The signal was fine, not as strong as the ones with the larger antennas, but in a small house/office this will work fine. I install the adapter on a machine running windows 10 without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Greenback Tech

customer_reviews.title: Works just like my old one
customer_reviews.text: Works just like my old one. replaced exact same unit that got broken when moving the computer. My old one was labeled CISCO and this one is LINKSYS but they are identical and works just fine on my home brew PC.
customer_reviews.author: Chilibob

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfect right from the start
customer_reviews.text: Edit/update....Since I last reviewed this, the product has become so inconsistent and obnoxious that I have stopped using it all together. I have had tried it on 3 different desktops and 2 laptops and it has the same issues. I'm going to see if I can get it replaced through the company as the return window has expired at amazon. I think it took me less then 2 minutes from start to finish (unboxing to it working). I would imagine that the bad reviews are just people who had a bad unit and that could indicate a quality control issue. Solid connection 100% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: thewavebb

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a month
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm to start, you do need Ethernet to download the drivers if your PC doesn’t have a CD reader (mine doesn’t). After a month, it just completely stopped working. I tried updating the drivers, I tried downgrading Windows. Nothing worked. Wouldn’t recommend
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I have an older laptop that had a max of a 54Mbps connection rate and my internet was bogging down. my computer wouldnt accept a newer card so i bought this hoping it would work and it works fantastically. If you need a quick and permanent fix to add or upgrade your wifi this will do the job. also reliable, no issues so far. Over all this is hightly recommended, great WIFI
customer_reviews.author: Edward Grey

customer_reviews.title: This was around 25ish USD and I bought two other (different) 10-15 USD generic USB adapters that have performed better.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this about a year ago and has not kept up well in terms of function or promised levels of performance. This was around 25ish USD and I bought two other (different) 10-15 USD generic USB adapters that have performed better.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Cardone

customer_reviews.title: Good WiFi adapter / make sure you have drivers before install
customer_reviews.text: Good cheap adapter for WiFi; windows 10 didn’t recognize it. Had to install drivers. Came with a cd but who uses Cd these days
customer_reviews.author: uz214

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I've bought this twice one for my sisters computer and one for my dads. It is small so they don't knock it around like a larger one and works and picks up great. It has a decent range on it. It also fits snugly in the usb slot and doesn't wiggle around like their old one.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: works great for me. never loose signal at about 18" from modem. plug and play was super easy quick recognition and use.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Works Flawlessly!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! My previous Panda unit was bent in a mishap (don’t ask!) so needed replacement. This works flawlessly for me.
customer_reviews.author: J. DuncanBoyden

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my desktop
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I recently moved and he started working from home, which meant he needed a hardline (ethernet cord) to his work computer in his office. Previously the router was always in my office, and my desktop connected to that via an ethernet cord. Rather than panic, I bought this wonder-gizmo to plug into my desktop and it worked like a charm. Especially when I upgraded the router to span our whole apartment.
customer_reviews.author: LannaLee

customer_reviews.title: Works great, no disconnects
customer_reviews.text: Works great, no disconnects, the down and up speed is just as good as my wired. I dont transfer files between my home network so not effected by the limitations. Id recommend. My down is 91.2mbps up is 12.94
customer_reviews.author: Gk

customer_reviews.title: Not for me.
customer_reviews.text: Got this to connect an old PC to my network. Setup is simple and everything seems to go fine but then it just doesn't really ever connect. Router and modem are in the next room. Finally gave up on it and just ran a 25ft wired connection from my PC to my router.
customer_reviews.author: JOSEPH GAMBLIN

customer_reviews.title: Price good range good set up easy
customer_reviews.text: Works great quick and easy to set up got decent range definitely can get from one side of house to the other definitely worth the price
customer_reviews.author: IFNLOV

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as it is intended to. Internal wireless ...
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as it is intended to. Internal wireless adaptor went out on our Dell Laptop and once we stuck this little guy in... Issue was resolved. We are a few months in to using it and we haven't had any issues. No need to be computer literate here...its plug-n-play Also, we did not have a DVD drive to run the installation DVD, but since it's plug and play this wasn't an issue
customer_reviews.author: KAM007

customer_reviews.title: Have to Reinstall Every Time
customer_reviews.text: I have to reconnect it every time I turn my computer on. Once and a while it'll be recognized by my computer, but essentially I have to reinstall it every time. I've just kept the CD in my CD drive to make the process faster. But once it's installed, it works very well. Fast internet to my desktop.
customer_reviews.author: Esq

customer_reviews.title: Need a CD drive or useless
customer_reviews.text: Could not use without installation on a CD which my laptop doesn't have so useless....
customer_reviews.author: keith

customer_reviews.title: Plug n go WiFi
customer_reviews.text: Plug this usb stick into your PC and have the fastest internet band “N” to give you reliable internet on the go
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Works great and easy to install— I’m not great with tech stuff, and this worked out perfectly for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ivy McGovern

customer_reviews.title: Wireless in the kids room with an old desktop!
customer_reviews.text: About the product: Works flawlessly, super simple to install and get up and running. My story: I have a 12 year old Dell desktop, thought it was at the end of it's life. Wiped the hard drive, reinstalled the OS and drivers, and she's back up and running. Old tech, so what the heck? A PC for the kids room. Problem: No internet connection in the kids room. Solution? This! It works flawlessly off of my wireless router, and I have three excited and happy children.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Kyle

customer_reviews.title: like many other reviews have stated
customer_reviews.text: The adapter was constantly disconnecting at random times, like many other reviews have stated, after my first review I updated the driver per Linksys' comments, that seemed to help some but just now before I started writing this review the adapter dropped out on me again to where I had to unplug it and plug it back in, not even using the setup disk would get it to reconnect, it's not the usb slots because I've tried multiple and had other stuff plugged into them with no problems. No windows 10 support yet, if you do decide to get this you have to use Windows 8 driver and install instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Kegan

customer_reviews.title: Not as strong as I'd like
customer_reviews.text: I was a little underwhelmed with the range on this...I know it's tiny but it just didn't seem to pick up the signal as well as my laptop that was in the same room as the PC I put this on.
customer_reviews.author: C. Horton

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Works like acharm on my windows 7 computer. Just plug it in & voila internet!
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: This is a great fast wireless dongle for Windows
customer_reviews.text: LINUX USERS BEWARE. This is a great fast wireless dongle for Windows, Instantly detected without installing drivers on Windows 10. Ubuntu (and other variants, I imagine) not so much. I've actually never had this issue with other dongles from Cisco or Netgear before. Did lots of research on this specific dongle with Linux and there are ZERO supported drivers for this, there are a few custom tweaks to maybe make it work that users will find a pain in the butt and aren't reliable. Look elsewhere if Linux is part of the picture. 5 stars for Windows, 0 for Linux.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works wonderfully
customer_reviews.text: Our ethernet port died on our computer. we bought this so we could once again get the internet to our desktop. Works amazing.
customer_reviews.author: manda_jean

customer_reviews.title: JUNK Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: Junk, blocks steam so you cannot play any games or even install the content. Although the range is decent being able to install it is a pain in the rear. Linkysys website is down most of the time and they havent updated the firmware of this since it was released. Dont buy this junk get the Netgear or dlink atleast you will have reliable service.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Steere

customer_reviews.title: Stops Working at Times
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my old adapter (as it was not compatible with my new PC build I did). It worked great for a few weeks, but then that's when it started just cutting out on me sometimes. I'll be using my PC as usual, then all at once the WiFi signal gets cut out. It's a simple fix luckily! I just unplug it and plug it back in. It happens about once every 2 weeks or so. Kind of annoying, but it's not a huge issue I think. I would prefer it didn't do that, but it works, and that's what matters.
customer_reviews.author: Margo B.

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Easy product to set up and gets the job done but having issues with BSoD. This may have stemmed from a prior wireless adapter install. Either way I’ll need to bring my PC in for repair.
customer_reviews.author: Alissa

customer_reviews.title: Has Range and easy to connect
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my father to use at his house to pick up the wifi from a back room inside of his metal house. It works well and hes been using it for 6+ months.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Cook

customer_reviews.title: Glad I purchased this!
customer_reviews.text: This rendered the internet connection on my old laptop far more reliable. I was considering a new one before the purchase of this adapter, so I think it more than paid for itself. Connection interruptions have all but stopped, so I have to believe its doing its job!
customer_reviews.author: Mike S

customer_reviews.title: Need Wifi?
customer_reviews.text: Plugs into the Usb port and with a little setup boom instant wifi
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: great for the price
customer_reviews.text: bought this for my old garage laptop whose wifi stopped working. This was easy to setup and worked perfectly (wifi signal comes from other end of the house).
customer_reviews.author: Ryan B.

customer_reviews.title: great for the price and works good for what I ...
customer_reviews.text: works okay, my windows 10 program is having issues updating itself using this adapter, other than that everything seems to be okay, great for the price and works good for what I use it for, for lots of things live streaming video or live TV you might want something a little faster.
customer_reviews.author: I.Ride.Aprilia

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: This works great on my kid's computer (Windows 10) easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this Item
customer_reviews.text: Great product at a fantastic price. Installed it the day it arrived and have not been sorry. I highly recommend this product for home wireless networks like ours.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Very compact
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to bring wireless AC to an older laptop with build in N only. Works well, range is good, and speed is good. Nice and small so it possible to keep it in the USB port while the laptop is in a bag but i take it out just to be safe. Seems to get quite warm but not enough to be a problem. Same price as on the manufacturer web site but free 2 day shipping on Amazon is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Eric in CT

customer_reviews.title: Was working fine for about a month and half and all of ...
customer_reviews.text: Was working fine for about a month and half and all of a sudden it just stopped working. Have tried different USB ports and nothing. Won't be buying it again. Seems like these things don't work for very long. Very dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hidalgo

customer_reviews.title: ... bought two of these for my house and I'm happy with them
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my house and I'm happy with them. Both computers connect to the wireless network well and the connection doesn't drop, or at least they did at first. My computer with Windows 7 works with it just fine, but when my boyfriend upgraded to Windows 10, this adapter ceased to work with his computer. So if you have Windows 10, I suggest getting a different adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Roessel

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work on my PC
customer_reviews.text: I was actually surprised about this. I have used the earlier model and it worked great. I was not only unable to download the drivers (CD), I was also not able to download the drivers I needed online. Kinda waste of money here for me
customer_reviews.author: T'Challa

customer_reviews.title: Am I happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Before using this wifi adapter I used a Netgear wireless-N adapter but was only pulling around 20-25Mbs. Our ISP plan was set around 60 Mbs. After installing and plugging in the new Linksys wifi adapter my download speed jumped to 40+Mbs. However, there's still more. My router offers a 5G connection which I connected to. Using Speedtest.net my download speed shot up to 60+ Mbs which is astounding. Am I happy with my purchase? Of course. This tiny wifi adapter greatly surpassed my expectations. Good job to Linksys!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't connect to Wifi!!
customer_reviews.text: Got it to put Wifi into my mother-in-law's TV in her nursing home but it's not getting connected. I know the Wifi works but it's not connecting to this. I spent hours on it and finally gave up. I have to call someone! to find out what is the issue but it's very frustrating. I thought it would be quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: B. A.

customer_reviews.title: Small little usb wifi dongle.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to test out 802.11ac compatibility of some new Cisco radios. Speed wasn't there. I could do better with the built in N radios, even when plugged into USB3.0. I think this is a USB 2.0 device which kind of defeats the whole purpose of 802.11ac. If it is a 3.0 device, then it only gets 2 stars. It works but if you're thinking about buying it to boost your wifi speeds, save your money and get the Asus, it has (2) radios and is twice as fast.
customer_reviews.author: mdisher

customer_reviews.title: Can't get this item to wortk.
customer_reviews.text: This item may be for overseas??? Can't get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: mrstorage

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!
customer_reviews.text: My parents needed internet acess in a different room and this works great as they stream a radio station via that computer and there haven't been any wifi droppage issue!! Thanx God!
customer_reviews.author: LeeRon

customer_reviews.title: So easy
customer_reviews.text: This was unbelievably easy to install and quick. I was anticipating all kinds of issues, but it went so smoothly. Can't recommend this product enough!
customer_reviews.author: Linda B.

customer_reviews.title: Laptop with no WiFi
customer_reviews.text: This brought to life an older laptop that didn’t have WiFi installed. Pretty cool
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

product_meta.title: Linksys AE1200 Wireless-N USB Adapter
product_meta.description: Model:N300Upgrade your computer with the freedom and reliability of Wireless-N. Just plug the Adapter into your computer's USB port to wirelessly connect to your network. With transfer rates up to 300 Mbps you'll enjoy a powerful networking experience for surfing, chatting, sharing or playing online. Built with leading 802.11n wireless technology, the Linksys AE1200 offers expanded coverage and reliability. MIMO (multiple input multiple output) antennas boost signal strength so you can stay connected whether at home or at Wi-Fi hotspots on the go.
feature_bullets: High Speed (up to 300 Mbps) for fast wireless transfer rates
Ideal for connecting anywhere in your home
Ideal for getting connected to Wi Fi hotspots

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,573 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
